Interface IActivationFunction<T>

Represents a node/neuron activation function.

Namespace: SharpNeat.NeuralNets
Assembly: SharpNeat.dll
Syntax
public interface IActivationFunction<T> where T : struct
Type Parameters
Name Description
T

Activation function numeric data type.

Methods

| Improve this Doc View Source

Fn(ref T, ref T, int)

The activation function; unsafe memory span implementation with separate input and output spans.

Declaration
void Fn(ref T vref, ref T wref, int len)
Parameters
Type Name Description
T vref

A reference to the head of a span containing pre-activation levels to pass through the function.
T wref

A reference to the head of a span in which the post-activation levels are stored.
int len

The length of the spans, i.e., the number elements in the spans.
| Improve this Doc View Source

Fn(ref T, ref T)

The activation function; scalar implementation, accepting a single variable reference. The pre-activation level is read from x; the post-activation result is stored to y.

Declaration
void Fn(ref T x, ref T y)
Parameters
Type Name Description
T x

The pre-activation variable reference.
T y

The post-activation variable reference.
| Improve this Doc View Source

Fn(ref T, int)

The activation function; unsafe memory span implementation.

Declaration
void Fn(ref T vref, int len)
Parameters
Type Name Description
T vref

A reference to the head of a span containing pre-activation levels to pass through the function. The resulting post-activation levels are written back to this same span.
int len

The length of the span, i.e., the number elements in the span.
| Improve this Doc View Source

Fn(ref T)

The activation function; scalar implementation, accepting a single variable reference. The pre-activation level is read from x; the post-activation result is stored to the same variable.

Declaration
void Fn(ref T x)
Parameters
Type Name Description
T x

The variable reference.

Fn(ReadOnlySpan<T>, Span<T>)

The activation function; span implementation with a separate input and output spans.

Declaration
void Fn(ReadOnlySpan<T> v, Span<T> w)
Parameters
Type Name Description
ReadOnlySpan<T> v

A span of pre-activation levels to pass through the function.
Span<T> w

A span in which the post-activation levels are stored.

Fn(Span<T>)

The activation function; span implementation.

Declaration
void Fn(Span<T> v)
Parameters
Type Name Description
Span<T> v

A span of pre-activation levels to pass through the function. The resulting post-activation levels are written back to this same span.
